title: Versioned Constitution Governance

problem.en: When an agent rewrites its own constitution (alignment rules), it may accidentally violate safety constraints or regress on alignment objectives if changes aren't properly reviewed and tracked.
problem.ko: 에이전트가 자체 헌법(정렬 규칙)을 재작성할 때, 변경 사항이 적절히 검토되고 추적되지 않으면 안전 제약을 실수로 위반하거나 정렬 목표에서 후퇴할 수 있습니다.

solution.en: Store the constitution in a version-controlled, signed repository. YAML/TOML rules live in Git with signed commits (Sigstore). CI runs automated policy checks. Agent can propose changes but only approved reviewers can merge.
solution.ko: 헌법을 버전 관리되고 서명된 저장소에 저장합니다. YAML/TOML 규칙은 서명된 커밋(Sigstore)과 함께 Git에 있습니다. CI는 자동화된 정책 검사를 실행합니다. 에이전트는 변경을 제안할 수 있지만 승인된 검토자만 병합할 수 있습니다.

mermaid_diagram:
flowchart TD
    A[Agent Runtime] -->|read-only| B[Git Repo: constitution.yaml]
    B --> C[Version History]
    A -->|proposes| D[Pull Request]
    D --> E[CI Policy Checks]
    E --> F{Passes?}
    F -->|Yes| G[Human Review]
    F -->|No| H[Reject - Safety Violation]
    G --> I{Approved?}
    I -->|Yes| J[Signed Commit Merge]
    I -->|No| K[Reject]
    J --> B
code_example:
# constitution.yaml - Version controlled alignment rules
version: 1.2
rules:
  - id: no_harmful_content
    description: Never generate harmful or illegal content
    severity: critical
    
  - id: respect_privacy
    description: Do not expose personal information
    severity: critical
    
  - id: cite_sources
    description: Provide citations for factual claims
    severity: warning

# Git workflow
git commit -S -m 'Update rule: cite_sources'  # Signed commit
# CI runs: python check_policy.py constitution.yaml
# - Flags deletions of critical rules
# - Validates rule schema
# - Only approved reviewers can merge
